Unmarked photo album
 1934-1937
Scope and Contents
Includes: Local 160, Bayonne, NJ, celebrating opening of educational season, October 26, 1934; Class in trade unionism, current events, Local 145, Passaic, NJ, January 21, 1935; Class in trade unionism, Local 144, Newark, NJ, January, 1935; Educational Department, ILGWU, Local 89 class in labor problems, Brooklyn, March 1, 1934; East Harlem Social and Educational Center, singing group, January 27, 1937; Local 62, class in labor problems, current events, February 11, 1935; Local 126, Hammonton, NJ, celebrating victory, ILGWU players presenting "All For One," October 27, 1934; Local 142 discussion group, trade unionism, February 4, 1935; ILGWU Educational Department Chorus, Corona, Long Island, February 5, 1935; ILGWU Players at Unity House, 1934; ILGWU Educational Department visit to Museum of Natural History, January 26, 1935; Class in trade unionism, current events, Local 143, Mt. Vernon, New York, January 22, 1935; Educational Department, Local 10 class in "History of Labor Movement," July 17, 1935; Chorus, Local 62, October 1934; Educational Department visit to Radio City, February 2, 1935; Class in trade unionism, Local 25, December 20, 1934; Educational meeting, Local 164, New Haven, Connecticut, September 14, 1934; Singing class, Local 126, Hammonton, New Jersey, Organized June 13, 1934; Chorus of Bridgeport Dress Makers Local 152, October 16, 1935; Mandolin Orchestra, Local 148, Union City, New Jersey, September 1934; Local 60, Class in English and trade unionism, April 10, 1935; Local 143, Mt. Vernon, New York, Installation of officers, April 5, 1935; Local 161, Paterson, New Jersey, celebrating beginning of educational season, February 15, 1935; Class in trade unionism, current events, Local 160, Bayonne, NJ, January 24, 1935; Reunion of students and instructors, Workers University, ILGWU, 1926; Educational Department presents Brookwood Players in New York City, April 28, 1934; Educational Department visit to Radio City, New York, January 26, 1935; Educational meeting, Local 60, Harlem, New York, October 29, 1934; Educational meeting, Local 60, Harlem, New York City, October 29, 1934; Local 32 Chorus, New York City, November 16, 1934; Local 32, New York City, celebrating beginning of educational season, November 16, 1934; Local 22, 1934; Class in English, Local 22, 1933; Officers and guests at second anniversary celebration, Local 151, State Armory, New Haven, Connecticut, February 9, 1935; Education Department; Audience at panel discussion at ILGWU Headquarters on March 4, 1950, of Welfare State; Leaving ILGWU Headquarters for Metropolitan Museum of Art, March 30, 1935; Local 117, Bronx, New York, November 19, 1934; Members, Cloak Operators Union, Local 117 and families attending B. Vladeck lecture at Hunts Point Palace, Bronx, February 19, 1934.
Box 114 Folder 5

Box 114 Folder 6
unmarked group photograph
Box 114 Folder 7
[Mothers Day, Kentucky Department of Highways marker]
Scope and Contents
Marker reads: Here, Mary Towles Sasseen Wilson in 1887, first observed mothers day. Started with her pupils. In 1893, she obtained national observance. Ky. Legislature recognized her as "originator of idea." Congress adopted second Sunday of May as holiday in 1914.

Cohn; ILGWU Chorus of Bridgeport, Connecticut, 1934; AFL-CIO Standing Committee on Education; Visit to Columbia University, Dean Hacker addressing ILGWU audience; Local 62, January 1938; Educational Department, An outing of a group of "chairladies," Local 62, Hook Mountain, August 4, 1932; Local 142, discussion group on trade unionism, February 4, 1935; Educational Department visit to Radio City, February 9, 1935; Educational department, Local 31, class in changing economic institutions, New York City, March 25, 1937; Educational Department visit to Museum of Natural History, January 26, 1935; Leaving ILGWU Headquarters for Metropolitan Museum of Art, March 30, 1935; Educational meeting, Corona, Long Island; Local 161, Celebrating beginning of educational season, February 15, 1935; Local 160, Bayonne, New Jersey, Celebrating opening of educational season, October 26, 1934; Educational department discussion group, Local 25, December 20, 1934; Hunter College, February 7, 1959; Educational department, Local 132, class in "Organized Labor and the Courts," April 1, 1937, New York City; Metropolitan Museum of Art, May 9, 1942; Unity House women's conference, August 2, 1935; Educational Department, New Haven, Connecticut, Celebrating beginning of educational season, September 14, 1934; Out-of-Town Department excursion, Steamer Benjamin B.
